intro: Neocleome, commonly known as the false cowpea, is a genus of flowering plants in the legume family, Fabaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. The plants typically have compound leaves and produce small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to purple. Neocleome species are often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. They are also known for their medicinal properties and have been used in traditional herbal remedies.
